p: In the prepared mixtures where the T. vulgaris was in 66.7% proportion, the activity was higher, regardless of the second ingredient in the mixture (exp. 6). However, the obtained activity was always higher for the mixtures than for the pure T. vulgaris essential oil. This could be indicative of the potentiated properties of the mixtures compared to the those of the essential oils individually (see Table 1). The following mixture proportions showed high values of antioxidant activity and also greater synergism: 66.7% T. vulgaris, 16.7% C. sativum and 16.7% A. graveolens.
